text: Is there a way I can include one module within another? For example, if I have created a module displaying a repeater of linked PDF files that I would like to include in another module for visual display but don't want to repeat code (I want to avoid a maintenance nightmare), what is the best way to do this? I have come across older articles, but nothing for the most recent design manager. Is there an "include" type statement?
Only way really is to copy the code/fields over
Really? This seems odd. You should be able to have parent/child or nested modules so you can create unique "sections" for quick drag-drop layouts
You can create a partial and include a module within it or multiple modules within it but you cant have modules within one another.
<@U38EZFVFE> I haven't come across partials yet. Do you know where I can find examples/documentation?

to piggy back on this. I have a custom module with social icons in the top right nav. within that module, I'd like to add a site search module. I'd like it within this specific module so I can use styling to slide everything over when the input field has focus. but what you're saying is that this just isn't possible? I receive this error and just verifying it's due to this issue. `'module' is disabled in this context.`
